comment._content:
This is NOT Saint Bavons abbey (Sint Baafsabdij), but Saint Bavons Cathedral (Sint Baafskathedraal).  
Originally the sites didn't have anything do do with each other.  The abbey is at the (old) city border, the cathedral is in town center and used to be a parish church called St John's.
In 1539, when emperor Charles V humiliated the inhabitants of Ghent, he erected his Spaniards' Castle on the abbey grounds and forced the monks out.  Those found a new place in St John's church which became St Bavon church and later, in 1559, St Bavon cathedral.
